ExpirationRuleHint.Default:
**Coupon Expiration Rule** Used to automatically calculate the expiration date of individual coupons. - **Days from encoding**: The coupon is valid "n" days after the purchasing date. - **End of week from encoding**: The coupon is valid until the end of the week of the purchasing date. If the coupon is purchased "n" days before the end of the week, the expiration will roll over to the next. - **End of month from encoding**: The coupon is valid until the end of the month of the purchasing date. If the coupon is purchased "n" days before the end of the month, the expiration will roll over to the next. - **End of year from encoding**: The coupon is valid until the end of the year of the purchasing date. If the coupon is purchased "n" days before the end of the year, the expiration will roll over to the next. - **One month from encoding**: The coupon is valid one month starting from the purchasing date. - **One year from encoding**: The coupon is valid one year starting from the purchasing date. - **Variable expiration date**: Operator will be asked to select one date. The coupon will be valid from the purchasing date to the selected date. - **Variable date range**: Operator will be asked to select two dates. The coupon will be valid between the selected dates. - **Variable validity day**: Operator will be asked to select one date. The coupon will be valid only the selected date. If quantity is specified, the coupon will be valid from the selected date for "n" days.
**Note** The rule is used only for individual coupons issued from the POS or through the SHOPCART APIs. The validity of individual coupons manually issued from the backoffice is selected by the operator.

EntitlementReplaceNeededHint.Default: A configuration override has been performed on this product. The product entitlements will be automatically replaced when the product is specifically accessed by the system (unique search, ticket scan, financial task etc).

EntitlementVersionHelp.Default:
The system will save the new entitlement configuration and mark all products that fall within the encode date range selected with a 'Refresh' status. The product entitlements will be automatically replaced when the product is specifically accessed by the system (unique search, product scan, financial task etc). In case of overlapping encode date ranges, SnApp will apply the entitlements of the last applicable override.
An example of the logic is provided below for clarity: 1. Product has a validity of 10 January - 25 January 2. An override is done to extend validity from 10 January - 30 January 3. Product is scanned on 20 January. Entitlements are automatically updated at time of product scan.
2nd scenario: 1. Product has a validity of 10 January - 25 January 2. An override is done to force early expiration and validity is shortened to 10 January - 20 January 3. Product is unused and has not been specifically queried by the system. Product will not expire on 20 January as expected since the product remains in a Refresh state.

SecUsageWaitDaysHint.Default:
Number of days, after the first valid redemption on the whole product, after which the product can be used again.
**Example** (assuming 1st redemption happens on **monday**): - If **value is 0**: no restrictions, second entry can happen anytime, including same day. - If **value is 1**: second entry cannot happen before **tuesday**. - If **value is 2**: second entry cannot happen before **wednesday**.

ChangeDueDateHint.Default: Allows the user to change the due date of the invoices

InvoiceCodeFormatHint.Default: Invoice number format combines optional static values with incremental year and serial numbering. Static values are represented in single quotation marks. The year is represented by Y where the number of Y characters equals the total length of the year string. The serial number is represented by S where the number of S characters equals the total length of the serial number string. Incremental values are automatically calculated by the system and reset when the year changes. Invoice numbering examples: YYYY'-'SSSSS = 2020-00001 'A'YYYY'/'SSSS = A2020/0001 'AA'YYYY'-'SSSSS = AA2020-00001 If invoice number configuration is changed, the serial number will restart from 1.

InvoiceWriteOffHint.Default: Write off the unsettled payments of the invoice

InvoiceRestoreHint.Default: Restore written off payments of the invoice

InvoiceIssueOnPaidOrdersHint.Default: Allows issuing of invoices on orders which are paid/settled

OrdersWithNegativePayments.Default: Contains voided or partially refunded orders

ManualLedgerDateTimeHint.Default: Allows a user to post a ledger entry in the past. The date/time value refers to the ledger transaction posting date/time. Based on this value, the system will calculate the appropriate fiscal date. If the box is not checked, the system will use todays date/time to calculate the ledger transaction date/time.

RegenerateHint.Default: Check and recalculate totals for a date range

RegenerateRightsHint.Default: Ability to regenerate/recalculate chart of accounts totals. The functionality does not re-apply ledger rules, neither modifies the ledger entry journal.

ManualEntryHint.Default:
Ability to post a manual ledger entry against a specific product or to the general ledger.
Options: - **INACTIVE** - **ACTIVE AND BLOCKED PRODUCTS ONLY:** Able to post entries to the general ledger as well as against any products which are in an active, inactive or blocked status - **ALL PRODUCTS:** Able to post entries to the general ledger and any product irrespective of its' status

MaskingRuleHint.Default: Rule to be used to mask the field value: - **EMPTY**: The field value will not be masked. - **GENERAL**: The field value will be masked using the settings defined below. - **DYNAMIC**: Half of the characters will be masked in the middle of the field value. Examples: 1234567890 -> 123\*\*\*\*890, 12345678 -> 12\*\*\*\*78, account@domain.com -> ac\*\*\*nt@domain.com

UnmaskedStartCharsHint.Default: Number of characters not to be masked at the beginning of the text. Examples: - 1: ABCD -> A\*\*\* - 2: ABCD -> AB\*\*

UnmaskedEndCharsHint.Default: Number of characters not to be masked at the end of the text. Examples: - 1: ABCD -> \*\*\*D - 2: ABCD -> \*\*CD

SplitWordsHint.Default: If flagged the rule wil be applied to each word Examples: - TRUE: New Value -> N\*e V\*\*\*e - FALSE: New Value -> New\*\*\*lue

MaskedMinCharsHint.Default: Minumum number of characters to be masked. Examples: - Unmasked start 2, unmasked end 2 minimum chars 5: ABCDEFG -> A\*\*\*\*\*G - Unmasked start 2, unmasked end 2 minimum chars 4: ABCDEFG -> AB\*\*\*\*G - Unmasked start 2, unmasked end 2 minimum chars 4: ABCD -> \*\*\*\*

MaskedMinCharsAlignHint.Default: Alignement of the masked characters. Examples: - Unmasked start 2, unmasked end 2, minimum chars 5 and align RIGHT: ABCDEFG -> AB\*\*\*\*\* - Unmasked start 2, unmasked end 2, minimum chars 5 and align LEFT: ABCDEFG -> \*\*\*\*\*FG

ExpirationUsageTypeHint.Default:
**Expiration Usage Rule** Allows the Valid To date of the product to be dynamically updated by the system if fully used. - **As scheduled**: Product Valid To date will be determined by the entitlement configuration only - even if product is fully used. - **On full usage**: Product Valid To date will be automatically updated to the last redemption date when all the entitlements on the product are fully used. - **On full admission usage**: Configuration is applicable for when a product contains both admission entitlements and redeemable products. Product Valid To date will be automatically updated to the last redemption date when all available admission entitlements are used, even if redeemable products still remain. - **On full product usage**: Configuration is applicable for when a product contains admission entitlements and redeemable products. Product Valid To date will be automatically updated to the last redemption date when all available redeemable product entitlements are used, even if admission entitlements still remain.
**Example scenario:** - Product is valid from 1 January 2020 - 5 January 2020. - Product is configured for admission only and contains no but also contains redeemable products. - All admission entitlements are fully used on 1 January. - All redeemable products are used on 2 January.
**Result:** - **As scheduled**: Product Valid To date remains as 5 Jan 2020. - **On full usage**: Product Valid To date is dynamically updated to 1 Jan after last entitlement on the product is used. - **On full admission usage**: Product Valid To date is dynamically updated to 1 Jan after last admission entitlement is used. - **On full product usage**: Product Valid To date of product remains as 5 Jan 2020 is dynamically updated to 2 Jan after last redeemable product is used.

ExtMediaGroupHint.Default: When a product type is associated to an External Media Group, SnApp will not generate it's own barcode, but will pick one from a pre-imported list of barcodes belonging to a partner

Product.ExtMediaGroupHint: Quando un prodotto è associato ad un Gruppo Media Esterno, SnApp non genererà uno dei suoi barcode, ma ne utilizzerà uno preso da una lista pre-importata, fornita da un partner

FeeTransactionPercHint.Default: The price of this product will be calculated as a percentage of the transaction amount. If the products in the shopcart are set as "Tax included.", the percentage is calculated on the transaction GROSS total amount, else it is calculated on the transaction NET total amount.

PerformanceFutureDaysHint.Default:
Number of days, starting from performance's location current date, for which is possible to book a performance. - **0** means that performance can be booked only for the current day. - **1** means that only today and tomorrow performances can be booked.
The fields **regular** and **elevated** represent the allowed number of days respectively for **every user** and **users with override capability**. Access to **elevated** quantity needs anyway to be manually activated by users allowed to.

PerformanceFutureQtyHint.Default:
Maximum number of outstanding bookings allowed. Are considered *outstanding* all bookings for not ended performances.
The fields **regular** and **elevated** represent the allowed number of days respectively for **every user** and **users with override capability**. Access to **elevated** quantity needs anyway to be manually activated by users allowed to.

ForceMediaGenerationHint.Default: Force media generation and print when the product is sold. This option prevent the ability to handle this product in POS's "media organize" screen.

ForceReceiptPrintHint.Default: Activating this option receipt will print if product is sold even if "Print receipt on demand only" option is enabled

GroupTicketOptionHint.Default: Configure how tickets should be printed and redeemed for groups. - **No group**: Selling a quantity of 5 will print 5 tickets and each one needs to be redeemed individually. - **1 scan, N rotations**: Selling a quantity of 5 will print just 1 ticket. When redeeming the ticket, the turnstyle will allow for 5 rotations (which have to be done in any case, even if the group show up with fewer people). - **N scan, N rotations**: Selling a quantity of 5 will print just 1 ticket. When redeeming the ticket, the turnstyle will allow only for 1 rotation, but will allow the same ticket to be scanned again to allow the rest of the group to come in. Entries will be correctly accounted for the times the ticket get scanned.

Product.GroupTicketOptionHint: Per i biglietti gruppo, viene stampato solamente un media, a prescindere dalla quantità selezionata. Il comportamento al controllo accessi (scansione singola o multipla) può essere configurato.

PreventDirectSaleHint.Default: Product sellable only when dependant on another product (ie: "guest product" linked to a "host product") or when added as bonus item by a promotion

GuestAutoAddToCartHint.Default: When checked, guest products are automatically added to the shopping cart along with the host product

ForceDynAttrViewHint.Default:
When a product type contains dynamic attributes, clients (POS, B2B, etc...) display them for user selection when the product type is clicked. - **Standard view**: illustrates all attributes with all their options on 1 screen. This modality is suggested if you have only few attributes. - **Dynamic view**: illustrates all attributes, while their options are displayed in a popup menu only when clicking. This modality is enforced when having more than 8 attributes or anyway by **selecting this option**
*Please note that this option is only meaningful when the product type has dynamic attributes*

HidePriceVisibility.Default: Hide price visibility on guest display and receipt

Product.HidePriceVisibility: Nascondi i prezzi su ricevuta e guest display

IgnoreEncodedEntitlementsHint.Default:
**Default behavior (inactive)**: Static entitlements defined at product type level, are "engraved" on each encoded product. Any change made on product type's static entitlement will take effect only on products encoded after that change. At redemption time, static entitlements engraved on the product will be anyway merged with dynamic entitlements coming from the product type.
**Ignore encoded static entitlements (active)**: Any static entitlements engraved on the product will be ignored at redemption time, and only dynamic entitlements coming from product type will be considered

EditEntitlementStaticHint.Default: Edit entitlement rules, defined at product type level, which will be merged with attribute's entitlement rules and stored a product (ticket) level.

EntitlementStaticHint.Default: Static entitlements along with attribute entitlements are always merged and then saved against the product at the time of encoding. When static or attribute entitlements are modified, the effect will only be observed on products which are encoded after the modification has occurred. If changes to static or attribute entitlements for already encoded products is required, then the #Versioning feature should be used.

EditEntitlementDynamicEntityHint.Default: Edit entitlement rules, defined at product type level, which will be dynamically merged with product's (ticket) entitlement rules at redemption time.

EntitlementDynamicEntityHint.Default: Entitlements are saved against the product type and contribute to create the "merged dynamic" entitlements.

EditEntitlementDynamicHint.Default: View entitlement rules which will be dynamically merged with product's (ticket) entitlement rules at redemption time.

EntitlementDynamicHint.Default: Dynamic entitlements are saved against the product type and are only merged into a products’ entitlement tree at redemption time. Since they are not directly saved to the product itself until the moment of redemption, they can be freely added and removed to modify the behaviour of already encoded and newly encoded tickets.

EntitlementDynamicExample.Default:
**At sale time** (attribute entitlements): - 1 entry - Water Park Event
After ticket is sold, **dynamic entitlements** are added to the product: - 2 entries - Theme Park Event
**Upon redemption** (Entitlements are merged. In the case of conflicting entitlements -in this example the number of entries-, the dynamic entitlement will always take precedence - 2 entries - Water Park Event - Theme Park Event

PrincipalHint.Default:
When encoded, the product will be identified as being a **principal** product. A portfolio may only contain one, active principal product. Non-principal products can be freely added to any portfolio. By default, product reissue/upgrade/downgrade of a principal product will not create a new portfolio.
Principal product information is stored at product type level. This means that activation of this parameter will also affect previously encoded products.
It should be noted that exceptions to principal product behaviour may be observed even after activation. Example: - Two products are already encoded and assigned to the same portfolio - The principal product parameter is subsequently activated on both products - SnApp will not automatically create a new portfolio. In this case, two principal products will be allowed to co-exist in the same portfolio.

ManualVerificationHint.Default: Determine how frequent a manual verification should be performed during access control: - **Never**: Never require manual verification. - **First use only**: Require manual verification on first use only. - **Daily first use only**: Require manual verification on first use of the day only. - **Random**: Require manual verification randomly with a probability of one out of N where N is the value of "Manual verification probability" configured at the topology level. - **Always**: Always require manual verification. - **Reentry only**: Require manual verification on reentries only.

ProductPriorityLevelHint.Default: "Secondary" tickets can exit only within "n" seconds after a "primary" ticket sold on the same transaction. The "n" seconds are set in location's configuration dialog: "product priority level" section. The primary ticket is linked to the secondary ones by the "portfolio group id value". A "portfolio group id" value defines a "family". If the accounts are created in the same transaction, both the "primary" and "secondary" tickets get the same "portfolio group id" value. If in a trasaction is selected an account with an associated "portfolio group id" value the new accounts created in the transaction will inherit the same "portfolio group id" value. If in a transaction are selected accounts with an associated "portfolio group id" value, every account will keep its own "portfolio group id" value.

Product.ProductPriorityLevelHint: I biglietti "secondari" possono uscire solo entro "n" secondi dopo un biglietto "primario" venduto nella stessa transazione. Gli "n" secondi sono configurabili sotto la sezione "livello priorità prodotti" nel dialog di configurazione della location.

PromoDisableTrnMinimumCapHint.Default:
By default, absolute amount discounts are applicable only when the discount amount is less or equal the transaction amount (sum of all items matching promotion rule constraints). By activating this option, the discount will be applicable even when the transaction amount is less than the discount amount.
**Example** (The configured discount value is $15 and the transaction amount is $10): - **Option enabled**: the discount is applicable and the discounted amount is $10 - **Option disabled**: the discount is not applicable
**Example** (The configured discount value is $15 and the transaction amount is $20): - **Option enabled**: the discount is applicable and the discounted amount is $15 - **Option disabled**: the discount is applicable and the discounted amount is $15

Product.PromoFilterByShopcartContent: Filtra in base al contenuto del carrello

PromoFilterByShopcartContentHint.Default: This promo will be activated if one of the following products is present in the shopcart or as transaction privilege card.

PromoMaxPerTransHelp.Default: Maximum times the promotion can be added to the same transaction. If the action is a percentage discount on the transaction, this parameter will reperesent the maximum number of items discountable by the promotion. In the case of individual coupon promotions, the max per transaction value refers to the maximum number of coupons that can be applied to the transaction.

Product.PromoMaxPerTransHelp: Numero massimo di volte in cui la promozione può essere aggiunta alla stessa transazione

PromoMinItemHelp.Default: The promotion will be active if the shopcart contains a number of items greater or equal to this value. If the "Min. item amount" is set, this count will consider only the items having an amount greater or equal to the "Min. item amount" value.

Product.PromoMinItemHelp: Per "numero minimo" considera solo gli elementi con importo maggiore o uguale a "valore minimo per elemento"

PromoPrdConstraintsHint.Default: Limits the applicability of the promotion within a time period per privilege card. It applies only to transactions linked to privilege cards.

PromoPrdNumberOfDaysHint.Default:
Optional field. Determines the number of days the system uses to calculate either the: - Benefit period: This applies when Last N days is selected - Benefit reset date: This value is only required if start of week/month/quarter/year has been selected as the benefit period and a specific day needs to be used to calculate the benefit reset date.
Examples: Staff member is eligible to receive 4 free tickets each week. Max Items: 4 Benefit Period: Start of Week Number of Days: Leave empty
Staff member is eligible to receive 4 free tickets every 30 days. Max Items: 4 Benefit Period: Last N days Number of Days: 30
Staff member is eligible to receive 4 free tickets with their benefit resetting on the 10th day of each month. Max Items: 4 Benefit Period: Start of Month Number of Days: 10

PromoPrdMaxItemCountHint.Default: Sets the maximum number of times the benefit can be availed by the privilege card holder during the period. Unused benefits do not roll over to the next period.

PromoBenefitPeriodHint.Default: Determines how the system should calculate the benefit period.

PromoShopcartRemovedWarning.Default: The promotion "%1" has been removed from the shopcart because is not applicable

Product.PromoShopcartRemovedWarning: Queste promozioni sono state rimosse dal carrello

PromoTagFilterHelp.Default: The discount will be applied only to products with the selected tags

Product.PromoTagFilterHelp: Lo sconto verrà applicato solo su prodotti che abbiano i tag selezionati

PromoTriggerQuantityMinHint.Default: If either category or product type is selected, it represents the minimum quantity to qualify for the discount. If wallet deposit is selected, it represents the minimum amount.

PromoTriggerQuantityStepHint.Default: If either category or product type is selected, it represents the step quantity of the products that will trigger the quantity of the discount accordingly. If wallet is selected, it represents the step amount that will trigger the quantity of the discount accordingly.

PromoVariableDiscountHint.Default: Discount amount/percentage will be set during sale. Available for manual promotions only.

TrnMaxQtyHint.Default: Max quantity for the specific product type allowed in an order. NOTE: Same product type sold with different prices is still included in the calculation to check the limit

RevRec_ApplyOnTotalHint.Default:
When **flagged**, SnApp will allocate revenue by gate category based on the total clearing limit of the product. When **not flagged**, SnApp will allocate revenue by gate category, less any absolute amounts.
Example: - Tax Exempt ticket valued at $100 - Clearing Limit 100% - Gate Category 1 Admissions - 100% - Gate Category 2 F&B - $20
Result: - **Flag on**: Gate Category Allocation $100 admissions|$20 F&B - **Flag off**: Gate Category Allocation $80 admissions|$20 F&B

RevRec_ExtractFromGrossHint.Default:
When selected, the percentage is calculated based on the total clearing limit as "gross".
Example: If the percentage is 10% and the clearing limit is $1100, the result should normally be $110 (as $110 is 10% of $1100). By selecting this flag, the calculation would return $100.

RewardPointClearingHint.Default:
**IMPORTANT** When product is configured as **"Bind wallet/reward points to product"** clearing will apply to points directly linked to the ticket (ex. initial deposit specified in the entitlements) and not to portfolio points amount (ex. topup from account).
When product is **NOT** configured as **"Bind wallet/reward points to product"** clearing will apply to portfolio points excluding points directly linked to the ticket.
Event that will trigger the reward point clearing - **Clearing**: Points cleared upon product clearing - **Breakage**: Points cleared upon product breakage - **Expiration**: Points cleared upon product expiration - **Portfolio expiration**: Points cleared only if all products in the portfolio are expired or are expiring all thogeter (not applicable if "Bind wallet/reward points to product")

TicketVoidAdvanceDaysHint.Default:
Allows to set a date threshold until when the refund is allowed. The threshold defines the number of days based on **visit date** until which refund is allowed. In case of the system is not able to calculate the **visit date** (ex. general admission products), the system will use as reference date, if exists, the **first usage date** otherwise the **validity end date**.
- **not set**: Refund always allowed - **-1**: Refund allowed until 1 day before visit date - **0**: Refund allowed until same day of visit date - **1**: Refund allowed until 1 day after visit date
**Example scenario:** Visit day: 31 December 1999
**Result:** - **not set**: Refund always allowed - **-1**: Refund allowed until 30 December 1999 - **0**: Refund allowed until 31 December 1999 - **1**: Refund allowed until 1 January 2000

TicketVoidAdvanceFeeDaysHint.Default:
Configure a fee to be charged to the guest when performing product refunds. Allows to also set a date threshold from when the fee should be applied. The threshold defines the number of days based on **visit date** until which the fee is not applied. In case of the system is not able to calculate the **visit date** (ex. general admission products), the system will use as reference date, if exists, the **first usage date** otherwise the **validity end date**.
- **not set**: Fee is always applied - **-1**: Fee not applied until 1 day before visit date (included) - **0**: Fee not applied until same day of visit date (included) - **1**: Fee not applied until 1 day after visit date (included)
**Example scenario:** Visit day: 31 December 1999
**Result:** - **not set**: Fee is always applied - **-1**: Fee not applied until 30 December 1999. Fee is applied starting from 31 December 2000. - **0**: Fee not applied until 31 December 1999. Fee is applied starting from 1 January 2000. - **1**: Fee not applied until 1 January 2000. Fee is applied starting from 2 January 2000.

TicketVoidSizeFeeListMismatch.Default: Size of the fee list provided doesn't match calculated fee list size

ProductTypeRenewalPolicyError.Default: Product type does not match selected product's renewal policy

RequireAccountOnEncodingOnlyHint.Default: When checked, account will be mandatory only on encoding step

RenewableFromAnyHint.Default: This product type can be selected as the "renewal target" of any product having the option "Renewable to any product". The operator is responsible to select an appropriate matching.

RenewableToAnyHint.Default: Encoded products of this type can be renewed to any product type having the option "Renewable from any product". The operator is responsible to select an appropriate matching.

RequiredPluginsHint.Default: Product sellable only from POS running all listed plugins. When empty, no restriction related to plugins is applied.

MembershipPluginHint.Default: Interface to an external membership validator

RestrictPaymentMethodsHint.Default: Defines what are the allowed payment methods when the product is sold. The available payment methods are the intersection between all product's restrictions in the shopping cart. If the flag is unchecked no restrictions on payments will be applied.

ProductNegativeTransactionHint.Default: Determine if product type can be used in a *"negative transaction"* - **NOT ALLOWED**: product type can be used only in **positive** transactions - **ALLOWED**: product type can be used both in **positive** and **negative** transactions - **NEGATIVE ONLY**: product type can be used only in **negative** transactions

TransferableHint.Default: This option enables products to be transferred between different accounts.

UsedProductsHint.Default: Number of days from first usage, after which upgrade will be prevented

ExpirationUpgradeDaysHint.Default: Number of days from product expiration, after which upgrade will be prevented

FromVisitUpgradeDaysHint.Default:
Number of days based on **visit date**, until which upgrade is allowed. In case of the system is not able to calculate the **visit date** (ex. general admission products), the system will use as reference date, if exists, the **first usage date** otherwise the **validity end date**.
- **not set**: Upgrade always allowed - **-1**: Upgrade allowed until 1 day before visit date - **0**: Upgrade allowed until same date of visit date - **1**: Upgrade allowed until 1 day after visit date
**Example scenario:** Visit day: 31 December 2020
**Result:** - **not set**: Upgrade always allowed - **-1**: Upgrade allowed until 30 December 2020 - **0**: Upgrade allowed until 31 December2020 - **1**: Upgrade allowed until 1 January 2021

FromVisitUpgradePerfDaysHint.Default:
Number of days based on **visit date**, until which is possible to change visit date while upgrading. - **not set**: Upgrade always allowed - **-1**: Upgrade allowed until 1 day before visit date - **0**: Upgrade allowed until same date of visit date - **1**: Upgrade allowed until 1 day after visit date
**Example scenario:** Visit day: 31 December
**Result:** - **not set**: Upgrade always allowed - **-1**: Upgrade allowed until 30 December 2020 - **0**: Upgrade allowed until 31 December 2020 - **1**: Upgrade allowed until 1 January 2021

LimitUpgradeMaxTimesHint.Default: Limit the max number of subsequent upgrades allowed. Configured in "Licensee \ Configuration dialog » Advanced \ Max upgrades/downgrades"

ChangePerformanceAdvanceDaysHint.Default:
Number of days based on **visit date**, until which a performance change is allowed
- **not set**: Performance change always allowed. - **-1**: Performance change allowed until 1 day before visit date - **0**: Performance change allowed until same date of visit date - **1**: Performance change allowed until 1 day after visit date
**Example scenario:** Visit day: 31 December 2020
**Result:** - **not set**: Performance change always allowed - **-1**: Performance change allowed until 30 December 2020 - **0**: Performance change allowed until 31 December 2020 - **1**: Performance change allowed until 1 January 2021

ChangeVisitDateFeeHint.Default:
Charge a fee when changing visit date on an encoded product: - **Fee**: product type fee applied; it also determins the fee amount. - **Days**: number of days based on **visit date**, until which the visit date can be changed.
**Days:** - **not set**: Visit date change always allowed. - **-1**: Visit date change allowed until 1 day before visit date - **0**: Visit date change allowed until same date of visit date - **1**: Visit date change allowed until 1 day after visit date
**Example scenario:** Visit day: 31 December 2020
**Result:** - **not set**: Visit date change always allowed - **-1**: Visit date change allowed until 30 December 2020 - **0**: Visit date change allowed until 31 December 2020 - **1**: Visit date change allowed until 1 January 2021

UpgradePreventChangePerformanceHint.Default: When enabled, a user will be prevented from changing the performance time during an upgrade/downgrade transaction. The ability to change the performance date during an upgrade/downgrade remains subject to the constraints set under the "Change Visit Date" parameter.

IgnoreAdmissionStatisticsHint.Default: Product type will not be considered for any admission statistic

UpgradeLocationNotAllowed.Default: Destination product type not allowed due to location restrictions

Product.UpgradeLocationNotAllowed: Il prodotto di destinazione non è valido a causa di restrizioni sui siti

UpgradeUsedTicketHint.Default: Allows the product to be upgraded also if already used

Product.VarDateTooLateError: Le date selezionate non possono essere successive al %1

VariableDescriptionHint.Default: Activating this option, the operator will be prompted when trying to sell this product, asked to enter a 'custom ticket description' to be used instead of the default (product type name)

VarpriceNewPresetAmountHint.Default: Enter absolute amount (ie '10' for '$ 10,00') or percentage amount (ie '10%' for '10 %')

VariablePriceFreeInputHint.Default: Allow then operator to manually enter the desired amount. Amount will anyway be capped between min/max configuration.

WalletClearingHint.Default:
**IMPORTANT** When product is configured as **"Bind wallet/reward points to product"** clearing will apply to wallet directly linked to the ticket (ex. initial deposit specified in the entitlements) and not to portfolio wallet amount (ex. topup from account).
When product is **NOT** configured as **"Bind wallet/reward points to product"** clearing will apply to portfolio wallet amount excluding wallet amount directly linked to the ticket.
Event that will trigger the wallet clearing - **Clearing**: Wallet cleared upon product clearing - **Breakage**: Wallet cleared upon product breakage - **Expiration**: Wallet cleared upon product expiration - **Portfolio expiration**: Wallet cleared only if all products in the portfolio are expired or are expiring all thogeter (not applicable if "Bind wallet/reward points to product")

Product.WritePerformanceAccount: Marca la performance con riferimento all'anagrafica

WritePerformanceAccountHint.Default: When this product type gets sold, if it has a performance reference, that performance will be marked with the "product owner" account

AmortizationPeriodsHint.Default: When set to auto, periods will be scheduled automatically within expiration date. If product has no expiration date no amortization periods will be scheduled

AmortizationDelayHint.Default: If different from zero, periods will be scheduled by "Finance reconciliation" task "Delay days" after start validity of the product.

AmortizationWithinExpirationHint.Default: When checked, at time of period scheduling, no periods with date after expiration date can be scheduled. If expiration date changes after, scheduled periods will NOT be updated.

BreakageValueNotAllowed.Default: Negative breakage value is not allowed

AmortizationPeriodValueNotValid.Default: "Periods" not valid unless "Periods within expiration date" is checked

VistitPerTicketNotValid.Default: Visit per ticket value not valid

DateFromGreaterThanDateTo.Default: Date from [%1] cannot be greater than date to [%2]

RevenueRecognitionGateEmpty.Default: Cannot create a revenue recognition without revenue recognition gate

RevenueRecognitionVPTValueNotValid.Default: Visit per ticket value not valid

RevenueRecognitionPercentageAmountWarn.Default: Total percentage is different from 100%. Confirm the changes?

RequireOrganizeStepHint.Default: When the product is sold, POS will display the "Media organize" screen, which allows to group media and products into portfolios. This option is ignored when "Force media print" or "Media exclusive use" are selected.

MediaAlreadyExistingHint.Default: Only media ALREADY registered into the system can be used

RevalidationStartDaysHint.Default: Revalidation window opening. Delta days from the original expiration date.

RevalidationEndDaysHint.Default: Revalidation window closure. Delta days from the original expiration date.

WindowStartEndDaysErrorMessage.Default: Window start days must be less than Window end days

RevalidationStartEndDaysErrorMessage.Default: Revalidation start days must be less than Revalidation end days

AutoGenDocAfterPaymentHint.Default: Force the generation of the document to happen after the payment screen. This makes it possible to use transaction variables (ie: TDSSN) in the template.

PrintValidityDescOnTrnReceipt.Default: Print validity description on transaction receipt

PrintValidityDescOnTrnReceiptHint.Default: The option allow to print validity description on transaction receipt (the validity description variable has to be correctly set on the template receipt.

ValidateSecurityRestrictionHint.Default: Requires a user with appropriate permissions when attempting to validate an order containing this product

ValidateFromVisitDateHint.Default: Ensure that an order containing this product can only be validate starting from the visit date

ValidateFromVisitDateError.Default: Product "%1" cannot be validated before visit date

GateCategoryHint.Default: Gate category used when redeeming included products linked to this product in the entitlements

EntitlementReplaceWizard_Description1.Default: This wizard allows to replace entitlements on encoded products.

EntitlementReplaceWizard_Description2.Default: Expired or otherwise voided products will not be modified.

Upsell_TargetProductSwapHint.Default: Product type offered as a "replacement" of the triggering one (like a "direct upgrade")

Upsell_SamePortfolioHint.Default: Add upselled product to the same portfolio as the main/triggering one

Upsell_QuantityMinHint.Default: Upsell minimun quantity constraint. When the upsell is configured as "same portfolio" the constraint is verified per portfolio, otherwise per order.

Upsell_QuantityMaxHint.Default: Upsell maximum quantity constraint. When the upsell is configured as "same portfolio" the constraint is verified per portfolio, otherwise per order.

Upsell_SwapConfirm.Default: Do you want to swap item "%1" with "%2" for %3

Upsell_WalletActionHint.Default: Set wallet deposit on all selected items

StopSaleCalendarHint.Default:
Dates for which the product is not sellable. Stop sale dates also impacts on upgrades/downgrades. If the source product is booked for a date and the target product has a "stop sale" on that same date, the upgrade/downgrade is not allowed.
There is one exception where the upgrade/downgrade will be permitted regardless if the target product is on a stop sale date: - The target product's start date is the same as the source product's start date **AND** - The target product's number of **entries** is the same or less than that of the source product's number of entries **AND** - The stop sale date is **SOFT** (or even **HARD** in case the source product is a **certificate**)
**SOFT** and **HARD** stop sale dates: To allow for the exception as described above, it is possible to specify individual days on the "stop sale calendar": - **SOFT** stop sale: an upgrade/downgrade is permitted under certain conditions; - **HARD** stop sale: an upgrade/downgrade is not allowed.

StopSaleError.Default: The selected product is currently not for sale.

StopSaleOverrideConfirm.Default: Would you like to add the product to the cart anyway?

StopSaleUpgradeSoftError.Default: The selected product does not meet the criteria for modification due to the following reason(s):

StopSaleUpgradeHardError.Default: The selected product is currently not available for upgrade/downgrade.

BearedTaxHint.Default: When flagged, tax linked to the product can concur on increasing the clearing limit

ExternalCheckCouponRedeemHint.Default: When flagged, SnApp will check existing individual coupon used at redemption also on external systems to validate status and validity. When the individual coupon is redeemed, SnApp will mark it as redeemed on external systems as well.

SuspendDateFromInThePast.Default: Start date cannot be in the past

SuspendDateFromAfterDateTo.Default: Start date cannot be after end date

SuspendDateFromNotChange.Default: Start date in the past cannot be changed

SuspendDatesOverlap.Default: Selected dates overlap with dates from another period (%1 to %2)

SuspendDateToInThePast.Default: End date cannot be in the past

SuspensionHint.Default:
During suspension periods products encoded linked to the product type are subject to the following rules: Finance reconciliation task ignores suspended products and does not trigger any expiration operation or amortization period Entry is not permitted for suspended products No usage, expiration and amortization periods ledger movements are performed on suspended products
When products transition from a suspended period to an active periods the following rules apply: Expiration rule is recalculated based on the number of days of suspension(s) when the product is used or when the finance reconciliation task pick it up due to original expiration date Amortization periods are recaluclated based on the number of days of suspension(s) when the product is used or when the finance reconciliation task pick it up due to period original date

ProductTypeSuspendedTillUnlimited.Default: Product type is suspended for an unlimited period of time

ApplyTaxOnFacePriceHint.Default: Taxes are calculated based on face price regardless of sale price or discounts

PerformanceSelectionTypeHint.Default:
Determine if and how a performance should be linked to the product. - **Not required**: General admission - **Before encoding**: Performance selection before encoding - **Before usage**: Performance selection before usage
NOTE: The value has effects only if the performance selection in the entitlements configuration is set as "Dynamic"

BindWalletRewardToProductHint.Default: Bind any wallet amount or reward points embedded in the product type entitlements to the **product** instead of the **portfolio**. All redemptions made against available wallet/reward points shall be limited to the balances left on the **product** only.

WalletRewardSingleUseHint.Default: Allow one time use against any available balances. Once used, unused balances (if any) will be automatically taken as breakage. Applicable only for products containing wallet or reward points.

WalletRewardPayPartialHint.Default: Allow to be used to partially pay a "Pay per use" transaction initiated by another product, in the same portfolio, with insufficient funds.

NotPrintableAtUnmannedWksHint.Default: Prevents the product to be printed at stations where an operator is not present like Kiosk, B2C, etc.

IssueForRefundHint.Default: Product type can be added to the shop cart during a refund (order or product) to be sold instead of returning money. The price will be assigned by the system and will be the remaining amount to be refunded, regardless of the price configuration of the product type.

PortfolioPriorityHint.Default:
Determines how the product should be organized in the portfolio list when sold. 1 represents the highest priority, empty represents the lowest priority. Example: - Product A is configured with no priority - Product B is configured with Priority "1" - Product C is configured with Priority "2"
When all three products are sold, the portfolio product list will reflect: 1. Product B 2. Product C 3. Product A
When issuing a new product, if the portfolio already contains other items with the same priority, the new product will be inserted after the last active item in the list with the same priority. Manual product prioritization can always override this portfolio sorting.

LocationHint.Default: The reward point rule applies only to redemptions made at the selected location.

OperatingAreaHint.Default: The reward point rule applies only to redemptions made at the selected operating area.
